author: George Bellshaw
title: Liverpool join Manchester United and Arsenal in race for Kostas Manolas
text:
Manolas is a target for Liverpool (Picture: Getty) Liverpool are keen to land Arsenal and Manchester United target Kostas Manolas after Jurgen Klopp sent scouts to watch him during Roma’s Europa League win against Lyon, reports claim.
The Greek centre-back was part of the Roma side that won 2-1 on the night but crashed out of the competition on aggregate.
When will Chelsea win the title as Conte eyes 21 points? But despite their European exit, Manolas impressed enough to convince Liverpool to join the race in signing him, according to the Daily Star.
The 25-year-old has two years left on his contract but he’s expected to leave the Stadio Olimpico this summer.

There will be plenty of suitors, should he decide to move on, with Liverpool’s local rivals Everton also keen.
Klopp is desperate, however, to add to his shaky backline and Manolas is high on his wish list.
